text.p: President Clinton Tuesday attended a Democratic Party fund-raiser that netted about $500,000 for the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee, which raises money for House Democratic candidates.
Clinton spent almost two hours at the Mayflower Hotel in downtown Washington at a reception and dinner for the party faithful.
A spokeswoman for the DCCC said tickets to the reception cost $1,000 each and tickets to the dinner cost $5,000 each.
Clinton was joined at the reception by House Minority Leader Dick Gephardt of Missouri and DCCC Chairman and Representative Martin Frost of Texas.
The president thanked the attendees for their political and financial support and said he was hopeful that Democrats would capture control of the House from Republicans in the 1998 election.
"We are working hard to bring back the House of Representatives to our party in the 1998 elections and let me assure you that it can be done," Clinton told supporters.
"I know that it can be done but what I want you to understand is that it should be done."
